metadata.title: CVE-2013-1577 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The dissect_sip_p_charging_func_addresses function inepan/dissectors/packet-sip.c in the SIP dissector in Wireshark 1.6.x before1.6.13 and 1.8.x before 1.8.5 does not properly handle offset dataassociated with a quoted string, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (infinite loop) via a malformed packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
